I'll be glad to give a more detailed response later, but most importantly is the fact that a permanent underclass never developed due to social mobility and that living conditions have been steadily increasing for everyone, of all classes. Also notable is that Marx's belief in the "inevitability of socialism" has been proven utterly wrong by the collapse of socialist countries and the socialist ideology being largely discredited; dialectical materialism was torn apart by Ludwig von Mises, as all things are the results of human action, not some vague movement of history.
Also, if you're tired of hearing "I used to be a commie", maybe it's because so many of us simply used to be communist. I was a Marxist-Leninist, anarcho-communist, De Leonist, and democratic socialist at various points, slowly drifting rightward.
